block.p: Kathleen Melinda Araskog, a daughter of Jessie and Rand V. Araskog of New York, was married last evening to Andrew Sebastian Thomas, a son of Sava and Roger W. Thomas, also of New York. The Rev. Brenda Husson performed the ceremony at St. James's Episcopal Church in New York.
The couple received M.B.A. degrees last Sunday from Duke University, where they met.

Kathleen Melinda Araskog, a daughter of Jessie and Rand V. Araskog of New York, was married last evening to Andrew Sebastian Thomas, a son of Sava and Roger W. Thomas, also of New York. The Rev. Brenda Husson performed the ceremony at St. James's Episcopal Church in New York.
The couple received M.B.A. degrees last Sunday from Duke University, where they met.

Mrs. Thomas, 30, also received her bachelor's degree from Duke. Her father, who retired as chairman of the ITT Corporation in New York, now owns RVA Enterprises, an investment management business in Palm Beach, Fla. Her mother is a member of the boards of the Society of the Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center, the Boys' Club of New York and the Women's Committee of the Central Park Conservancy.
In August, Mr. Thomas, 28, is to become an associate in the private-client services group at Lehman Brothers, the New York investment bank. He graduated from Bowdoin College.

His mother is a lawyer in private practice in New York and is on the boards of Civitas, an East Side planning group and the Spanish Repertory Theater. His father is a partner in Cleary, Gottlieb, Steen & Hamilton, the New York law firm.
